title: ion-searchbar
body: Searchbars represent a text field that can be used to search through a collection. They can be displayed inside of a toolbar or the main content.

A Searchbar should be used instead of an input to search lists. A clear button is displayed upon entering input in the searchbar's text field. Clicking on the clear button will erase the text field and the input will remain focused. A cancel button can be enabled which will clear the input and lose the focus upon click.
By default, tapping the input will cause the keyboard to appear with a magnifying glass icon on the submit button. You can optionally set the
, which will change the icon from a magnifying glass to a carriage return.
By default, tapping the input will cause the keyboard to appear with the text "return" on a gray submit button. You can optionally set the
, which will change the text from "return" to "go", and change the button color from gray to blue. Alternatively, you can wrap the
property. This will cause the keyboard to appear with a blue submit button that says "search".

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button never shown -->
<!-- Searchbar with cancel button shown on focus -->
<!-- Searchbar with a cancel button and custom cancel button text -->

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button never shown -->

// Searchbar with cancel button never shown

props.name: cancelButtonIcon
props.docs: Set the cancel button icon. Only applies to md mode. Defaults to "arrow-back-sharp".

props.name: cancelButtonText
props.docs: Set the the cancel button text. Only applies to ios mode.

props.name: clearIcon
props.docs: Set the clear icon. Defaults to "close-circle" for ios and "close-sharp" for md.

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the ionChange event after each keystroke.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the input.

props.name: enterkeyhint
props.docs: A hint to the browser for which enter key to display. Possible values: "enter", "done", "go", "next", "previous", "search", and "send".

props.name: inputmode
props.docs: A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display. Possible values: "none", "text", "tel", "url", "email", "numeric", "decimal", and "search".

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs:
Set the input's placeholder. placeholder can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string. To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they must be escaped. For example <Ionic> would become <Ionic>

For more information: Security Documentation

props.name: searchIcon
props.docs: The icon to use as the search icon. Defaults to "search-outline" in ios mode and "search-sharp" in md mode.

props.name: showCancelButton
props.docs: Sets the behavior for the cancel button. Defaults to "never". Setting to "focus" shows the cancel button on focus. Setting to "never" hides the cancel button. Setting to "always" shows the cancel button regardless of focus state.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native <input> element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs: Sets focus on the specified ion-searchbar. Use this method instead of the global input.focus().

docs:
Searchbars represent a text field that can be used to search through a collection. They can be displayed inside of a toolbar or the main content.

A Searchbar should be used instead of an input to search lists. A clear button is displayed upon entering input in the searchbar's text field. Clicking on the clear button will erase the text field and the input will remain focused. A cancel button can be enabled which will clear the input and lose the focus upon click.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the cancel button is clicked.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the clear input button is clicked.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the searchbar input

styles.name: --box-shadow
styles.docs: Box shadow of the searchbar input

styles.name: --cancel-button-color
styles.docs: Color of the searchbar cancel button

styles.name: --clear-button-color
styles.docs: Color of the searchbar clear button

styles.name: --placeholder-font-style
styles.docs: Font style of the searchbar placeholder

styles.name: --placeholder-font-weight
styles.docs: Font weight of the searchbar placeholder
